com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.views

Class MapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.views.MapView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public final class MapView
extends android.widget.FrameLayout
    A MapView provides an embeddable map interface, similar to the one provided by the Google Maps API. You use this class to display map information and to manipulate the map contents from your application. You can center the map on a given coordinate, specify the size of the area you want to display, and style the features of the map to fit your application's use case.

    Use of MapView requires a Mapbox API access token. Obtain an access token on the Mapbox account page.

    Warning: Please note that you are responsible for getting permission to use the map data, and for ensuring your use adheres to the relevant terms of use.

    See Also:
    setAccessToken(String)

      • MAXIMUM_ZOOM_LEVEL

        public static final double MAXIMUM_ZOOM_LEVEL
        The currently supported maximum zoom level.
        See Also:
        setZoomLevel(double), Constant Field Values

      • REGION_WILL_CHANGE

        public static final int REGION_WILL_CHANGE
        This event is triggered whenever the currently displayed map region is about to changing without an animation.

        This event is followed by a series of REGION_IS_CHANGING and ends with REGION_DID_CHANGE.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REGION_WILL_CHANGE_ANIMATED

        public static final int REGION_WILL_CHANGE_ANIMATED
        This event is triggered whenever the currently displayed map region is about to changing with an animation.

        This event is followed by a series of REGION_IS_CHANGING and ends with REGION_DID_CHANGE_ANIMATED.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final int WILL_START_LOADING_MAP

        Parameters:

        accessToken - Your public Mapbox access token. Used to load map styles and tiles.
        styleUrl - A URL to the map style initially displayed. See setStyleUrl(String) for possible values.

      • setCenterCoordinate

        public void setCenterCoordinate(LatLng centerCoordinate)
        Centers the map on a new coordinate immediately without changing the zoom level.

        The initial coordinate is (0, 0).

        If you want to animate the change, use setCenterCoordinate(LatLng, boolean).

        Parameters:
        centerCoordinate - The new coordinate.
        See Also:
        setCenterCoordinate(LatLng, boolean)

      • setCenterCoordinate

        public void setCenterCoordinate(LatLng centerCoordinate,
                       boolean animated)
        Centers the map on a new coordinate without changing the zoom level and optionally animates the change.

        The initial coordinate is (0, 0).

        Parameters:
        centerCoordinate - The new coordinate.
        animated - If true, animates the change. If false, immediately changes the map.

      • setCenterCoordinate

        public void setCenterCoordinate(LatLngZoom centerCoordinate)
        Centers the map on a new coordinate immediately while changing the current zoom level.

        The initial value is a center coordinate of (0, 0) and a zoom level of 0.

        If you want to animate the change, use setCenterCoordinate(LatLngZoom, boolean).

        Parameters:
        centerCoordinate - The new coordinate and zoom level.
        See Also:
        setCenterCoordinate(LatLngZoom, boolean)

      • resetPosition

        public void resetPosition()
        Resets the map to the minimum zoom level, a center coordinate of (0, 0), a true north heading, and animates the change.

        The initial value is a center coordinate of (0, 0) and a zoom level of 0.

        centerCoordinate - The new coordinate and zoom level.
        animated - If true, animates the change. If false, immediately changes the map.

      • isScrollEnabled

        public boolean isScrollEnabled()

        Returns:
        If true, scrolling is enabled.

      • setScrollEnabled

        public void setScrollEnabled(boolean scrollEnabled)
        Changes whether the user may scroll around the map.

        This setting controls only user interactions with the map. If you set the value to false, you may still change the map location programmatically.

        The default value is true.

        Parameters:
        scrollEnabled - If true, scrolling is enabled.

      • getDirection

        public double getDirection()
        Returns the current heading of the map relative to true north.
        Returns:
        The current heading measured in degrees.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(double direction)
        Rotates the map to a new heading relative to true north immediately.

        The value 0 means that the top edge of the map view will correspond to true north.
        The value 90 means the top of the map will point due east.
        The value 180 means the top of the map will point due south.
        The value 270 means the top of the map will point due west.

        The initial heading is 0.

        If you want to animate the change, use setDirection(double, boolean).

        Parameters:
        direction - The new heading measured in degrees.
        See Also:
        setDirection(double, boolean)

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(double direction,
                boolean animated)
        Rotates the map to a new heading relative to true north and optionally animates the change.

        The value 0 means that the top edge of the map view will correspond to true north.
        The value 90 means the top of the map will point due east.
        The value 180 means the top of the map will point due south.
        The value 270 means the top of the map will point due west

        The initial heading is 0.

        Parameters:
        direction - The new heading measured in degrees from true north.
        animated - If true, animates the change. If false, immediately changes the map.

      • getZoomLevel

        public double getZoomLevel()
        Returns the current zoom level of the map view.
        Returns:
        The current zoom level.

      • setZoomLevel

        public void setZoomLevel(double zoomLevel)
        Zooms the map to a new zoom level immediately without changing the center coordinate.

        At zoom level 0, tiles cover the entire world map; at zoom level 1, tiles cover ¼ of the world; at zoom level 2, tiles cover 1/16 of the world, and so on.

        The initial zoom level is 0. The maximum zoom level is MAXIMUM_ZOOM_LEVEL.

        If you want to animate the change, use setZoomLevel(double, boolean).

        Parameters:
        zoomLevel - The new coordinate.
        See Also:
        setZoomLevel(double, boolean), MAXIMUM_ZOOM_LEVEL

      • setZoomLevel

        public void setZoomLevel(double zoomLevel,
                boolean animated)
        Zooms the map to a new zoom level and optionally animates the change without changing the center coordinate.

        At zoom level 0, tiles cover the entire world map; at zoom level 1, tiles cover ¼ of the world; at zoom level 2, tiles cover 1/16 of the world, and so on.

        The initial zoom level is 0. The maximum zoom level is MAXIMUM_ZOOM_LEVEL.

        Parameters:
        zoomLevel - The new coordinate.
        animated - If true, animates the change. If false, immediately changes the map.
        See Also:
        MAXIMUM_ZOOM_LEVEL

      • setStyleUrl

        public void setStyleUrl(java.lang.String url)
        Loads a new map style from the specified URL.

        url can take the following forms:

        • Style.*: load one of the bundled styles in Style.
        • mapbox://styles/<user>/<style>: retrieves the style from a Mapbox account. user is your username. style is the ID of your custom style created in Mapbox Studio.
        • http://... or https://...: retrieves the style over the Internet from any web server.
        • asset://...: reads the style from the APK asset/ directory. This is used to load a style bundled with your app.
        • null: loads the default Style.MAPBOX_STREETS style.

        This method is asynchronous and will return immediately before the style finishes loading. If you wish to wait for the map to finish loading listen for the DID_FINISH_LOADING_MAP event.

        If the style fails to load or an invalid style URL is set, the map view will become blank. An error message will be logged in the Android logcat and DID_FAIL_LOADING_MAP event will be sent.

        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the map style
        See Also:
        Style

      • setStyle

        public void setStyle(java.lang.String style)
        Loads a new map style from the specified bundled style.

        This method is asynchronous and will return immediately before the style finishes loading. If you wish to wait for the map to finish loading listen for the DID_FINISH_LOADING_MAP event.

        If the style fails to load or an invalid style URL is set, the map view will become blank. An error message will be logged in the Android logcat and DID_FAIL_LOADING_MAP event will be sent.

        Parameters:
        style - The bundled style. Accepts one of the values from Style.
        See Also:
        Style

      • getStyleUrl

        public java.lang.String getStyleUrl()
        Returns the map style currently displayed in the map view.

        If the default style is currently displayed, a URL will be returned instead of null.

        Returns:
        The URL of the map style.

        Parameters:

        See Also:
        setStyleClasses(List, long), setStyleUrl(String)

        See Also:

        public void setAccessToken(java.lang.String accessToken)

        You must set a valid access token before you call onCreate(Bundle) or an exception will be thrown.

        You can use ApiAccess.getToken(Context) to load an access token from your application's manifest.

        Parameters:
        accessToken - Your public Mapbox access token.
        See Also:
        onCreate(Bundle), ApiAccess.getToken(Context)

      • addMarker

        public Marker addMarker(MarkerOptions markerOptions)
        Adds a marker to this map.

        The marker's icon is rendered on the map at the location Marker.position. If Marker.title is defined, the map shows an info box with the marker's title and snippet.

        Parameters:
        markerOptions - A marker options object that defines how to render the marker.
        Returns:
        The Marker that was added to the map.

        Parameters:
        markerOptionsList - A list of marker options objects that defines how to render the markers.
        Returns:
        A list of the Markers that were added to the map.

        A list of all the annotation objects. The returned object is a copy so modifying this list will not update the map.

      • getMetersPerPixelAtLatitude

        public double getMetersPerPixelAtLatitude(double latitude)
        Returns the distance spanned by one pixel at the specified latitude and current zoom level.

        The distance between pixels decreases as the latitude approaches the poles. This relationship parallels the relationship between longitudinal coordinates at different latitudes.

        Parameters:
        latitude - The latitude for which to return the value.
        Returns:
        The distance measured in meters.

      • selectMarker

        public void selectMarker(Marker marker)
        Selects a marker. The selected marker will have it's info window opened. Any other open info windows will be closed.

        Selecting an already selected marker will have no effect.

        Parameters:
        marker - The marker to select.

      • deselectMarker

        public void deselectMarker()
        Deselects any currently selected marker. The selected marker will have it's info window closed.

      • setVisibleCoordinateBounds

        public void setVisibleCoordinateBounds(CoordinateBounds bounds)
        Changes the map's viewport to fit the given coordinate bounds.
        Parameters:
        bounds - The bounds that the viewport will show in its entirety.

      • setVisibleCoordinateBounds

        public void setVisibleCoordinateBounds(CoordinateBounds bounds,
                              boolean animated)
        Changes the map's viewing area to fit the given coordinate bounds, optionally animating the change.
        Parameters:
        bounds - The bounds that the viewport will show in its entirety.
        animated - If true, animates the change. If false, immediately changes the map.

      • setVisibleCoordinateBounds

        public void setVisibleCoordinateBounds(CoordinateBounds bounds,
                              android.graphics.RectF padding,
                              boolean animated)
        Changes the map’s viewport to fit the given coordinate bounds with additional padding at the edge of the map, optionally animating the change.
        Parameters:
        bounds - The bounds that the viewport will show in its entirety.
        padding - The minimum padding (in pixels) that will be visible around the given coordinate bounds.
        animated - If true, animates the change. If false, immediately changes the map.

      • setVisibleCoordinateBounds

        public void setVisibleCoordinateBounds(LatLng[] coordinates,
                              android.graphics.RectF padding,
                              boolean animated)
        Changes the map’s viewport to fit the given coordinates, optionally some additional padding on each side and animating the change.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The coordinates that the viewport will show.
        padding - The minimum padding (in pixels) that will be visible around the given coordinate bounds.
        animated - If true, animates the change. If false, immediately changes the map.

        Gets the currently selected marker.
        Returns:
        The currently selected marker.

      • addOnMapChangedListener

        public void addOnMapChangedListener(MapView.OnMapChangedListener listener)
        Add a callback that's invoked when the displayed map view changes.

        To remove the callback, use removeOnMapChangedListener(OnMapChangedListener).

        Parameters:
        listener - The callback that's invoked on every frame rendered to the map view.
        See Also:
        removeOnMapChangedListener(OnMapChangedListener)

      • removeOnMapChangedListener

        public void removeOnMapChangedListener(MapView.OnMapChangedListener listener)
        Remove a callback added with addOnMapChangedListener(OnMapChangedListener)
        Parameters:
        listener - The previously added callback to remove.
        See Also:
        addOnMapChangedListener(OnMapChangedListener)

      • onMapChanged

        protected void onMapChanged(int mapChange)

      • setInfoWindowAdapter

        public void setInfoWindowAdapter(MapView.InfoWindowAdapter infoWindowAdapter)
        Sets a custom renderer for the contents of info window.

        When set your callback is invoked when an info window is about to be shown. By returning a custom View, the default info window will be replaced.

        Parameters:
        infoWindowAdapter - The callback to be invoked when an info window will be shown. To unset the callback, use null.

      • getInfoWindowAdapter

        public MapView.InfoWindowAdapter getInfoWindowAdapter()
        Gets the callback to be invoked when an info window will be shown.
        Returns:
        The callback to be invoked when an info window will be shown.

        Parameters:

      • isMyLocationEnabled

        public boolean isMyLocationEnabled()
        Returns the status of the my-location layer.
        Returns:
        True if the my-location layer is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setMyLocationEnabled

        public void setMyLocationEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables the my-location layer. While enabled, the my-location layer continuously draws an indication of a user's current location and bearing.

        In order to use the my-location layer feature you need to request permission for either Manifest.permission.ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION or @link android.Manifest.permission#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION.

        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable; false to disable.

      • getMyLocation

        public android.location.Location getMyLocation()
        Returns the currently displayed user location, or null if there is no location data available.
        Returns:
        The currently displayed user location.

      • setOnMyLocationChangeListener

        public void setOnMyLocationChangeListener(MapView.OnMyLocationChangeListener listener)
        Sets a callback that's invoked when the the My Location dot (which signifies the user's location) changes location.
        Parameters:
        listener - The callback that's invoked when the user clicks on a marker. To unset the callback, use null.

      • setMyLocationTrackingMode

        public void setMyLocationTrackingMode(int myLocationTrackingMode)
        Sets the current my location tracking mode.

        My location racking disables gestures, automatically moves the viewport to the users location and shows the direction the user is heading.

        Parameters:
        myLocationTrackingMode - The my location tracking mode to use. Accepts one of the values from MyLocationTracking.Mode.
        See Also:
        MyLocationTracking.Mode

      • getMyLocationTrackingMode

        public int getMyLocationTrackingMode()
        Returns the current user location tracking mode.
        Returns:
        The current user location tracking mode. One of the values from MyLocationTracking.Mode.
        See Also:
        MyLocationTracking.Mode

      • isCompassEnabled

        public boolean isCompassEnabled()
        Returns whether the compass is enabled.
        Returns:
        True if the compass is enabled; false if the compass is disabled.

      • setCompassEnabled

        public void setCompassEnabled(boolean compassEnabled)
        Enables or disables the compass. The compass is an icon on the map that indicates the direction of north on the map. When a user clicks the compass, the camera orients itself to its default orientation and fades away shortly after. If disabled, the compass will never be displayed.

        By default, the compass is enabled.

        Parameters:
        compassEnabled - True to enable the compass; false to disable the compass.

      • setCompassGravity

        public void setCompassGravity(int gravity)
        Sets the gravity of the compass view. Use this to change the corner of the map view that the compass is displayed in.

        By default, the compass is in the top right corner.

        Parameters:
        gravity - One of the values from Gravity.
        See Also:
        Gravity

      • setCompassMargins

        public void setCompassMargins(int left,
                     int top,
                     int right,
                     int bottom)
        Sets the margins of the compass view. Use this to change the distance of the compass from the map view edge.
        Parameters:
        left - The left margin in pixels.
        top - The top margin in pixels.
        right - The right margin in pixels.
        bottom - The bottom margin in pixels.

      • setLogoGravity

        public void setLogoGravity(int gravity)
        Sets the gravity of the logo view. Use this to change the corner of the map view that the Mapbox logo is displayed in.

        By default, the logo is in the bottom left corner.

        Parameters:
        gravity - One of the values from Gravity.
        See Also:
        Gravity

      • setLogoMargins

        public void setLogoMargins(int left,
                  int top,
                  int right,
                  int bottom)
        Sets the margins of the logo view. Use this to change the distance of the Mapbox logo from the map view edge.
        Parameters:
        left - The left margin in pixels.
        top - The top margin in pixels.
        right - The right margin in pixels.
        bottom - The bottom margin in pixels.

      • setLogoVisibility

        public void setLogoVisibility(int visibility)
        Enables or disables the Mapbox logo.

        By default, the compass is enabled.

        Parameters:
        visibility - True to enable the logo; false to disable the logo.

      • setAttributionGravity

        public void setAttributionGravity(int gravity)
        Sets the gravity of the attribution button view. Use this to change the corner of the map view that the attribution button is displayed in.

        By default, the attribution button is in the bottom left corner.

        Parameters:
        gravity - One of the values from Gravity.
        See Also:
        Gravity

      • setAttributionMargins

        public void setAttributionMargins(int left,
                         int top,
                         int right,
                         int bottom)
        Sets the margins of the attribution button view. Use this to change the distance of the attribution button from the map view edge.
        Parameters:
        left - The left margin in pixels.
        top - The top margin in pixels.
        right - The right margin in pixels.
        bottom - The bottom margin in pixels.

      • setAttributionVisibility

        public void setAttributionVisibility(int visibility)
        Enables or disables the attribution button. The attribution is a button with an "i" than when clicked shows a menu with copyright and legal notices. The menu also inlcudes the "Improve this map" link which user can report map errors with.

        By default, the attribution button is enabled.

        Parameters:
        visibility - True to enable the attribution button; false to disable the attribution button.
